channel.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
channel.description:
Its my client compiler
@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin"*.java pause
on my server compiler so when i change ips the compiler doesnt do jack i just put the path to my javac+java folder
anyone have a compiler that works with an x86?

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

try

@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You didn’t set your variable CLASS/PATH variable correctly. If you had, it would recognize javac as a valid program.

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @dropthebeat dropthebeat
item.description:
@dropthebeat wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:431664”]No. I’m not going to “teamviewer” anyone.

There is one compiler; javac.

If your variables are set correctly, then simply calling

javac *.java

Will suffice.[/quote]

javac
not recognized as an internal or external command

@echo off
COLOR C
ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity
ECHO Please wait patiently...
TITLE Compile - Client
javac *.java*
pause

is inside the compiler
sec ill get the env varbales but i know i set them right

using 7u2 jdk

CLASSPATH
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_2\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_2\bin




path to my java
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

No. I’m not going to “teamviewer” anyone.

There is one compiler; javac.

If your variables are set correctly, then simply calling

javac *.java

Will suffice.

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @dropthebeat dropthebeat
item.description:
@dropthebeat wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:431664”][quote author=dropthebeat link=topic=534370.msg3906650#msg3906650 date=1328306692]
Its my client compiler

@echo off
COLOR C
ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity
ECHO Please wait patiently…
TITLE Compile - Client
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin”*.java
pause

on my server compiler so when i change ips the compiler doesnt do jack
i just put the path to my javac+java folder

anyone have a compiler that works with an x86?

[/quote]

  1. Set your environment variables to include Java
  2. Use “java/c” instead of the whole “C:\x\y\z\javac.exe”[/quote]

my env varibles are fine, i have 4 compilers 2 for servers one is i guess the eco one which works after long fixing, the server compiler doesnt, and both of the client ones dont,

and what do you mean by set it to java/c? anyway you could team view since this is been bugging me for almost 3 days trying to get this boob online for my friends

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---

item.title: Compiler problem---not in the comman ones so please help---
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“dropthebeat, post:1, topic:431664”]Its my client compiler

@echo off
COLOR C
ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity
ECHO Please wait patiently…
TITLE Compile - Client
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin”*.java
pause

on my server compiler so when i change ips the compiler doesnt do jack
i just put the path to my javac+java folder

anyone have a compiler that works with an x86?[/quote]

  1. Set your environment variables to include Java
  2. Use “java/c” instead of the whole “C:\x\y\z\javac.exe”

Read full topic
